How to Install multiboot on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • multiboot

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install multiboot on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing multiboot on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall multiboot in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install multiboot, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install multiboot Using apt

To install multiboot in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install multiboot using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install multiboot

The installation of multiboot might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install multiboot Using apt-get

To install multiboot using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install multiboot.

sudo apt-get -y install multiboot

Install multiboot Using Synaptic

To install multiboot using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install multiboot on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for multiboot. This will display the multiboot package in the package window, now to install multiboot, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the multiboot package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of multiboot.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install multiboot Using aptitude

To install multiboot on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of multiboot.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install multiboot using the command aptitude install multiboot.

sudo aptitude -y install multiboot

How to Upgrade multiboot on debian

If you want to upgrade the multiboot package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade multiboot using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade multiboot to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade multiboot.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade multiboot sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade multiboot

Upgrade multiboot using Aptitude

To upgrade multiboot using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade multiboot.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade multiboot

Upgrade multiboot using Synaptic

To upgrade multiboot using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for multiboot, now right-click multiboot, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade multiboot just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall multiboot on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall multiboot from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just multiboot, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove multiboot

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of multiboot

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of multiboot you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge multiboot

Remove multiboot using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall multiboot using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for multiboot, right-click the multiboot package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall multiboot click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install multiboot on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade multiboot using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of multiboot then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
